GFA Lunch Aide position available

Want to work in an energetic environment with great people?

We are looking for someone who enjoys interacting with students and adults in a courteous customer
service oriented manner, works well on a team and is willing to learn and dependable. This position is active and
requires standing and movement during working hours.

Hours for the 2019-20 school year are expected to be 10:30 am- 1:00 pm.

Food handlers permit is required. This can be acquired on-site.

Duties include:
• Assisting students during lunch sessions
• Supervises student behavior while maintaining a safe and positive environment
• Ensures the cafeteria is clean and sanitary
• Follows health, food service and other government regulations

Duties may rotate to include point of sale, food preparation and serving.

Dear Parents,

I have enjoyed reading through all of the short stories, poems, and projects you’ve sent me over the last month. I appreciate how supportive all of you have been through this process. According to most of the news outlets, there is a winter storm warning for tonight and tomorrow morning. We've already had a couple of storms that didn't turn into the nightmares they predicted, but since this might be hitting as you are waking up tomorrow morning, we wanted to give you a reminder of how you will be notified of any potential changes to our schedule tomorrow.

Thanks for everything you do for our kids!

Sincerely,

Dave Dau

Riverdale, Utah

On Thursday, one of the Kindergarten students came to school with some medication in their backpack. Neither the parent nor the student let us know that the medication was there. When the student got home, the medicine was gone.

While the risk to your child is low, we ask, as a precaution, that you please check your child's back pack to make sure they do not have anything that they shouldn’t have. The medicine is "Aripiprazola" which is a tiny pill that is orange/pink. They would be cut in half. The pill might have SD 327 printed on it. There might also be another bag containing purple fluoride tablets.

We apologize for any stress this may cause. It is a good reminder for why we ask all medicine to be checked into the main office. If you find the medicine, please notify our main office at 801-393-2950. If not, thanks for checking.

Dave Dau
Executive Director

If you have any other concerns about something you see on our web page, please contact the school as soon as possible.

Respectfully,
Dave Dau

Today the Apex team taught us step #4 in becoming STRONG leaders - learning how to Overcome. To overcome means to face challenges head on as we are confronted with them, keeping the mindset that we can endure and getting through it! No matter how difficult the obstacle, we must find a way to overcome.

The Apex team used the double A rule: Attitude and Action! We learned that attitude is the way you think and feel, and action is what you do. With a positive attitude and immediate, appropriate action, STRONG leaders can overcome. Remember, leaders never quit!

Here is tonight’s challenge-

The class with the highest jump in pledges, gets a pizza party next week!
